content: truffle features a simple lace rib pattern that looks like tiny little cables however these are mock cables formed by a basic slipped stitch sequence followed by a yarn over the pattern repeat is easy to memorize as it is only five row long and five stitches wide the striking crown decreases are inspired by the wonderful jacques cousteau hat the overall lace ribbing is also very stretchy and will accomodate a wide range of sizes making this a great project for gift knitting truffle belongs to the **box of chocolates** collection of patterns along with the bonbons mitts and the nougat neckwarmer http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/bonbons http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/nougat-2 questions or comments about my designs interested in kals & mkals join **susanna ic** group on ravelry http //www ravelry com/groups/susanna-ic
